ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Maybe. The final essay is interesting, even though the classes themselves are not as interesting.

This course would be beneficial for anyone, who is interested in understanding theoretical and empirical insigths into democracy promotion as one of the most commonly employed instruments especially by the Western countries or leading international institutions to increase the standards of democracy in other countries.

I would recommend this course to anyone interested in learning about democracy and democracy promotion.This course offers a good general history of democracy promotion, primarily from a U.S. perspective. The course will give you a clear understanding of the varying theories that organizations, individuals and countries use to rationalize democracy promotion, and give you the opportunity to understand the various controversies surrounding the practice of promoting democracy (both in receptive and non-receptive countries).

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course allowed me to learn more about the role of democracy on the continent of Africa; how it is rationalized, how it has impacted foreign relations between the US and african countries, and what role it has in development.
This course was decisive in strengthening my foundations for further study; beyond the seminar discussions, the final assignment provided an important space for me to define my area of focus further.
